page.title: 16WARRENDER SCHOOL RUISLIP
page.content: In Warrender Primary School there are 290 pupils from 3-11.At a time of falling rolls the school has 35 to a class and 52 applications for 10 nursery places.There are 8 class teachers and 3 part timers as the ratio is 1 teacher to 26.5 pupils. Council spending cuts have meant the loss of French and fewer Music lessons.The Parent Teacher Association is very active and increasingly raises money for basic items like books. In the nursery the children learn through play in the infants they start to learn to read and write. By the juniors most of the learning through play stops and there is more bookwork. School dinners have changed a lot. There used to be a set hot meal. Now we have Cafeteria meals. At 11 years pupils leave to go to a local Secondary School like Bishop Ramsey.
